credit_line: Gift of the son and daughters of Charles Bolles Bolles-Rogers, Class of 1907: Frederick Van D. Rogers, Mary Rogers Savage, and Nancy Rogers Pierson
title: Standing Draped Woman, Possibly Aphrodite
description: polychrome in red, white, blue. Probably grave offering from Tanagra necropolis. Solid head is from bivalve mold, front of hollow remainder is from single mold, and back of remainder is handmade in one piece, unmodeled unpainted, and largely cut out to form rectangular vent.  Figure stands in contrapposto balanced on left leg.
inscriptions: on base, label: 74; on base in graphite: 3 [?]
